citation.article-title: Taxonomic studies on some human cutaneous coryneform bacteria: description of Dermabacter hominis gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Dermabacter (Der.ma.bacter. Gr.n. derma skin; M.L. masc.n. bacter the masculine equivalent of the Gr.neut.n. bactrum a rod)
Gram-positive, non-sporeforming, non-acid fast, non-motile, short rods.
Acid is produced from glucose and some other sugars.
Aesculin, casein and starch are hydrolysed.
Cellulose, hippurate, tyrosine and xanthine are not hydrolysed.
Cell wall peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimetic acid, alanine and glutamic acid.
The principal menaquinone is MK-9 with MK-8 and MK-7 also present.
The long-chain fatty acids are predominantly of the iso- and anteiso-methyl branched types.
The major polar lipids consist of diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, some phosphotipids and a diglycosyldiacylglycerol.
The mol% G + C content of DNA is 62 (Tm).
The type species is Dermabacter hominis.
